memberdef.type: typename SpinResolvedBase< USpinOrbitalBasisComponent< ExpansionScalar, Shell >, Self >::Of
memberdef.name: ComponentType

memberdef.argsstring: (const ScalarBasis< Shell > &alpha_scalar_basis, const ScalarBasis< Shell > &beta_scalar_basis, const UTransformation< ExpansionScalar > &C)
memberdef.name: USpinOrbitalBasis

detaileddescription.para: Create an USpinOrbitalBasis from an alpha and a beta-spin-orbital basis and a transformation that expresses the current spin-orbitals in terms of that underlying scalar basis.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar basis in which the alpha spin-orbitals are expanded.
The scalar basis in which the beta spin-orbitals are expanded.
The transformation that relates the current set of spinors with the atomic spinors.

detaileddescription.para: Construct an unrestricted spin-orbital basis in which both underlying scalar bases and their expansions are equal.

parameterdescription.para: The scalar basis in which both the alpha and beta spin-orbitals are expanded.
The transformation that expresses the current spin-orbitals in terms of the underlying scalar basis.

detaileddescription.para: Construct an unrestricted spin-orbital basis with two different underlying scalar bases, and a coefficient matrix being the identity. The resulting spin-orbital basis then corresponds to the (non-orthogonal) atomic spin-orbitals (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The scalar basis in which the alpha spin-orbitals are expanded.
The scalar basis in which the beta spin-orbitals are expanded.

detaileddescription.para: Construct an unrestricted spin-orbital basis in which both underlying scalar bases are equal, and the coefficient matrix being the identity. The resulting spin-orbital basis then corresponds to the (non-orthogonal) atomic spin-orbitals (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The scalar basis in which both the alpha and beta spin-orbitals are expanded.

detaileddescription.para: Construct an unrestricted spin-orbital basis with underlying scalar bases (equal for both the alpha and beta components) that are made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specification on every nucleus of the nuclear framework. The resulting spin-orbital basis then corresponds to the (non-orthogonal) atomic spin-orbitals (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The nuclear framework containing the nuclei on which the shells of the scalar basis should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G".

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

detaileddescription.para: Construct an unrestricted spin-orbital basis with underlying scalar bases (equal for both the alpha and beta components) that are made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specification on every nucleus of the molecule. The resulting spin-orbital basis then corresponds to the (non-orthogonal) atomic spin-orbitals (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The molecule containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G".

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

detaileddescription.para: Construct an unrestricted spin-orbital basis with underlying scalar bases made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specifications on every nucleus of the nuclear framework. The resulting spin-orbital basis then corresponds to the (non-orthogonal) atomic spin-orbitals (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The nuclear framework containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the alpha spin-orbitals.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the beta spin-orbitals.

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

detaileddescription.para: Construct an unrestricted spin-orbital basis with underlying scalar bases made by placing shells corresponding to the basisset specifications on every nucleus of the molecule. The resulting spin-orbital basis then corresponds to the (non-orthogonal) atomic spin-orbitals (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The molecule containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the alpha spin-orbitals.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G", used for the expansion of the beta spin-orbitals.

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Molecule &molecule, const std::string &basisset_name, const HomogeneousMagneticField &B, typename std::enable_if< std::is_same< Z, LondonGTOShell >::value >::type *=0)
memberdef.name: USpinOrbitalBasis

detaileddescription.para: Construct a unrestricted spin-orbital basis with an underlying scalar basis that is made by placing shells (equal for both the alpha and beta components) corresponding to the basisset specification on every nucleus of the molecule. The resulting spinor basis corresponds to the non-orthogonal London atomic spinors (AOs).

parameterdescription.para: The molecule containing the nuclei on which the shells should be centered.
The name of the basisset, e.g. "STO-3G".
The homogeneous magnetic field.

simplesect.para: The normalization factors of the spherical (or axis-aligned Cartesian) GTO primitives are embedded in the contraction coefficients of the underlying shells.
The transformation that expresses the current spin-orbitals in terms of the underlying scalar basis.
The total number of spinors/spin-orbitals that this spin-orbital basis describes.
The total number of spin-orbitals that this spin-orbital basis describes.

detaileddescription.para: Check if this spin-orbital basis is orthonormal, within a given precision.

parameterdescription.para: The precision used to test orthonormality.

simplesect.para: If this spin-orbital basis is orthonormal.
The transformation to the Löwdin basis. See also SimpleSpinOrbitalBasis.

detaileddescription.para: Transform this spin-orbital basis to the 'Löwdin basis'. See also SimpleSpinOrbitalBasis.

memberdef.definition: USQOneElectronOperator< product_t< ElectronicSpin_zOperator::Scalar, ExpansionScalar >, ElectronicSpin_zOperator::Vectorizer > GQCP::USpinOrbitalBasis< _ExpansionScalar, _Shell >::quantize
memberdef.name: quantize

detaileddescription.para: Quantize the z-component of the electronic spin operator in this unrestricted spin-orbital basis, i.e. express/project the one-electron operator in/onto this spin-orbital basis.

parameterdescription.para: The first-quantized one-electron operator.

simplesect.para: The second-quantized operator corresponding to the given first-quantized operator.

detaileddescription.para: Quantize the electronic S^2 operator in this spin orbital basis.

parameterdescription.para: The first-quantized electronic S^2 operator.

simplesect.para: The second-quantized representation of the electronic S^2 operator in this spin orbital basis.

parameterdescription.para: The first-quantized one-electron operator.

simplesect.para: The second-quantized operator corresponding to the given first-quantized operator.

detaileddescription.para: Quantize the overlap operator in this spin-orbital basis.

simplesect.para: The second-quantized overlap operator.

detaileddescription.para: Quantize a one-electron operator in this unrestricted spin-orbital basis, i.e. express/project the one-electron operator in/onto this spin-orbital basis.

The type of the first-quantized one-electron operator.

detaileddescription.para: MARK: Mulliken domain Partition this set of unrestricted spin-orbitals according to the Mulliken partitioning scheme.

parameterdescription.para: A function that returns true for basis functions that should be included the Mulliken Domain.

simplesect.para: A UMullikenDomain for the AOs selected by the supplied selector function.

detaileddescription.para: Partition this set of unrestricted spin-orbitals according to the Mulliken partitioning scheme.

parameterdescription.para: A function that returns true for shells that should be included the Mulliken Domain.

simplesect.para: A UMullikenDomain for the AOs selected by the supplied selector function.

detaileddescription.para: Create an unrestricted spin-orbital basis from a restricted spin-orbital basis, leading to alpha- and beta- coefficient matrices that are equal.

parameterdescription.para: The restricted spin-orbital basis.

simplesect.para: An USpinOrbitalBasis that corresponds to the given restricted one.
